Theory Commitment_Schemes

sectionâ€¹Commitment Schemesâ€º

textâ€¹A commitment scheme is a two party Cryptographic protocol run between a committer and a verifier.
They allow the committer to commit to a chosen value while at a later time reveal the value. A commitment
scheme is composed of three algorithms, the key generation, the commitment and the verification algorithms.
 
The two main properties of commitment schemes are hiding and binding.â€º


textâ€¹Hiding is the property that the commitment leaks no information about the committed value, and 
binding is the property that the committer cannot reveal their a different message to the one they
committed to; that is they are bound to their commitment. We follow the game based approach \cite{DBLP:journals/iacr/Shoup04} to
define security. A game is played between an adversary and a challenger.â€º

theory Commitment_Schemes imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
begin

subsectionâ€¹Defining securityâ€º
textâ€¹Here we define the hiding, binding and correctness properties of commitment schemes.â€º 

textâ€¹We provide the types of the adversaries that take part in the hiding and binding games. We consider 
two variants of the hiding property, one stronger than the other --- thus we provide two hiding adversaries.
The first hiding property we consider is analogous to the IND-CPA property for encryption schemes, the second, 
weaker notion, does not allow the adversary to choose the messages used in the game, instead they are sampled 
from a set distribution.â€º

type_synonym ('vk', 'plain', 'commit', 'state) hid_adv = 
  "('vk' â‡’ (('plain' Ã— 'plain') Ã— 'state) spmf)
   Ã— ('commit' â‡’ 'state â‡’ bool spmf)"

type_synonym 'commit' hid = "'commit' â‡’ bool spmf"

type_synonym ('ck', 'plain', 'commit', 'opening')  bind_adversary = 
  "'ck' â‡’ ('commit' Ã— 'plain' Ã— 'opening' Ã— 'plain' Ã— 'opening') spmf"

textâ€¹We fix the algorithms that make up a commitment scheme in the locale.â€º

locale abstract_commitment =
  fixes key_gen :: "('ck Ã— 'vk) spmf" â€• â€¹outputs the keys received by the two partiesâ€º
    and commit :: "'ck â‡’ 'plain â‡’ ('commit Ã— 'opening) spmf" â€• â€¹outputs the commitment as well as the opening values sent by the committer in the reveal phaseâ€º
    and verify :: "'vk â‡’ 'plain â‡’ 'commit â‡’ 'opening â‡’ bool" 
    and valid_msg :: "'plain â‡’ bool" â€• â€¹checks whether a message is valid, used in the hiding gameâ€º
begin

definition "valid_msg_set = {m. valid_msg m}"

definition lossless :: "('pub_key, 'plain, 'commit, 'state) hid_adv â‡’ bool"
  where "lossless ğ’œ âŸ·
   ((âˆ€pk. lossless_spmf (fst ğ’œ pk)) âˆ§
        (âˆ€commit Ïƒ. lossless_spmf (snd ğ’œ commit Ïƒ)))"

textâ€¹The correct game runs the three algorithms that make up commitment schemes and outputs the output
of the verification algorithm.â€º

definition correct_game :: "'plain â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "correct_game m = do {
  (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
  (c,d) â† commit ck m;
  return_spmf (verify vk m c d)}"

lemma   "âŸ¦ lossless_spmf key_gen; lossless_spmf TI;
          â‹€pk m. valid_msg m âŸ¹ lossless_spmf (commit pk m) âŸ§
              âŸ¹ valid_msg m âŸ¹ lossless_spmf (correct_game m)"
  by(simp add: lossless_def correct_game_def split_def Let_def)

definition correct where "correct â‰¡ (âˆ€m. valid_msg m âŸ¶ spmf (correct_game m) True = 1)"

textâ€¹The hiding property is defined using the hiding game. Here the adversary is asked to output two
messages, the challenger flips a coin to decide which message to commit and hand to the adversary.
The adversary's challenge is to guess which commitment it was handed. Note we must check the two 
messages outputted by the adversary are valid.â€º

primrec hiding_game_ind_cpa :: "('vk, 'plain, 'commit, 'state) hid_adv â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "hiding_game_ind_cpa (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2) = TRY do {
  (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
  ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 vk;
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
  b â† coin_spmf; 
  (c,d) â† commit ck (if b then m0 else m1);
  b' :: bool â† ğ’œ2 c Ïƒ;
  return_spmf (b' = b)} ELSE coin_spmf"

textâ€¹The adversary wins the game if â€¹b = b'â€º.â€º

lemma lossless_hiding_game:
  "âŸ¦ lossless ğ’œ; lossless_spmf key_gen;
     â‹€pk plain. valid_msg plain âŸ¹ lossless_spmf (commit pk plain) âŸ§
  âŸ¹ lossless_spmf (hiding_game_ind_cpa ğ’œ)"
  by(auto simp add: lossless_def hiding_game_ind_cpa_def split_def Let_def)

textâ€¹To define security we consider the advantage an adversary has of winning the game over a tossing 
a coin to determine their output.â€º

definition hiding_advantage_ind_cpa :: "('vk, 'plain, 'commit, 'state) hid_adv â‡’ real"
  where "hiding_advantage_ind_cpa ğ’œ â‰¡ Â¦spmf (hiding_game_ind_cpa ğ’œ) True - 1/2Â¦"

definition perfect_hiding_ind_cpa :: "('vk, 'plain, 'commit, 'state) hid_adv â‡’ bool"
  where "perfect_hiding_ind_cpa ğ’œ â‰¡ (hiding_advantage_ind_cpa ğ’œ = 0)"

  textâ€¹The binding game challenges an adversary to bind two messages to the same committed value. Both
opening values and messages are verified with respect to the same committed value, the adversary wins
if the game outputs true. We must check some conditions of the adversaries output are met;
we will always require that â€¹m â‰  m'â€º, other conditions will be dependent on the protocol for example 
we may require group or field membership.â€º

definition bind_game :: "('ck, 'plain, 'commit, 'opening) bind_adversary â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "bind_game ğ’œ = TRY do {
  (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
  (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ ck;
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');
  let b = verify vk m c d;
  let b' = verify vk m' c d';
  return_spmf (b âˆ§ b')} ELSE return_spmf False"

textâ€¹We proof the binding game is equivalent to the following game which is easier to work with. In particular 
we assert b and b' in the game and return True.â€º

lemma bind_game_alt_def:
  "bind_game ğ’œ = TRY do {
  (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
  (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ ck;
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');
  let b = verify vk m c d;
  let b' = verify vk m' c d';
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (b âˆ§ b'); 
  return_spmf True} ELSE return_spmf False"
  (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof -
  have "?lhs = TRY do {
      (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
      TRY do {
        (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ ck;
        TRY do {
          _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');
          TRY return_spmf (verify vk m c d âˆ§ verify vk m' c d') ELSE return_spmf False
        } ELSE return_spmf False
      } ELSE return_spmf False
    } ELSE return_spmf False"
    unfolding split_def bind_game_def
    by(fold try_bind_spmf_lossless2[OF lossless_return_spmf]) simp
  also have "â€¦ = TRY do {
      (ck, vk) â† key_gen;
      TRY do {
        (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ ck;
        TRY do {
          _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');
          TRY do {
            _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (verify vk m c d âˆ§ verify vk m' c d');
            return_spmf True
          } ELSE return_spmf False
        } ELSE return_spmf False
      } ELSE return_spmf False
    } ELSE return_spmf False"
    by(auto simp add: try_bind_assert_spmf try_spmf_return_spmf1 intro!: try_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong)
  also have "â€¦ = ?rhs"
    unfolding split_def Let_def
    by(fold try_bind_spmf_lossless2[OF lossless_return_spmf]) simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma lossless_binding_game: "lossless_spmf (bind_game ğ’œ)" 
  by (simp add: bind_game_def)

definition bind_advantage :: "('ck, 'plain, 'commit, 'opening) bind_adversary â‡’ real"
  where "bind_advantage ğ’œ â‰¡ spmf (bind_game ğ’œ) True"

end

end

Theory Cyclic_Group_Ext

theory Cyclic_Group_Ext imports 
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
begin

context cyclic_group begin

lemma generator_pow_order: "â™g [^] order G = ğŸ­"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  hence fin: "finite (carrier G)" by(simp add: order_gt_0_iff_finite)
  then have [symmetric]: "(Î»x. x âŠ— â™g) ` carrier G = carrier G"
    by(rule endo_inj_surj)(auto simp add: inj_on_multc)
  then have "carrier G = (Î» n. â™g [^] Suc n) ` {..<order G}" using fin 
    by(simp add: carrier_conv_generator image_image)
  then obtain n where n: "ğŸ­ = â™g [^] Suc n" "n < order G" by auto
  have "n = order G - 1" using n inj_onD[OF inj_on_generator, of 0 "Suc n"] by fastforce
  with True n show ?thesis by auto
qed simp

lemma generator_pow_mult_order: "â™g [^] (order G * order G) = ğŸ­"
  using generator_pow_order 
  by (metis generator_closed nat_pow_one nat_pow_pow)

lemma pow_generator_mod: "â™g [^] (k mod order G) = â™g [^] k"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  obtain n where n: "k = n * order G + k mod order G" by (metis div_mult_mod_eq)
  have "â™g [^] k = (â™g [^] order G) [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] (k mod order G)" 
    by(subst n)(simp add: nat_pow_mult nat_pow_pow mult_ac)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: generator_pow_order)
qed simp

lemma pow_carrier_mod: 
  assumes "g âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "g [^] (k mod order G) = g [^] k"
  using assms pow_generator_mod 
  by (metis generatorE generator_closed mod_mult_right_eq nat_pow_pow)

lemma pow_generator_mod_int: "â™g [^] ((k::int) mod order G) = â™g [^] k"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  obtain n :: int where n: "k = n * order G + k mod order G"   
    by (metis div_mult_mod_eq)
  have "â™g [^] k = (â™g [^] order G) [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] (k mod order G)" 
    apply(subst n)apply(simp add: int_pow_mult int_pow_pow mult_ac)
    by (metis generator_closed int_pow_int int_pow_pow mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: generator_pow_order)
qed simp

lemma pow_generator_eq_iff_cong:
  "finite (carrier G) âŸ¹ â™g [^] x = â™g [^] y âŸ· [x = y] (mod order G)"
  apply(subst (1 2) pow_generator_mod[symmetric])
  by(auto simp add: cong_def order_gt_0_iff_finite intro: inj_onD[OF inj_on_generator])

lemma power_distrib: 
  assumes "h âˆˆ carrier G" 
  shows "â™g [^] (e :: nat) âŠ— h [^] e = (â™g âŠ— h ) [^] e"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  obtain x :: nat where x: "h = â™g [^] x" 
    using assms generatorE by blast
  hence "?lhs = â™g [^] (e * (1 + x))" 
    by (simp add: nat_pow_mult mult.commute nat_pow_pow)
  also have "... = (â™g [^] (1 + x)) [^] e" 
    by (metis generator_closed mult.commute nat_pow_pow)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by (metis x One_nat_def generator_closed l_one monoid.nat_pow_Suc monoid_axioms nat_pow_0 nat_pow_mult)
qed

lemma neg_power_inverse:
  assumes "g âˆˆ carrier G" 
    and "x < order G"
  shows "g [^] (order G - (x :: nat)) = inv (g [^] x)"
proof-
  have "inv (g [^] x) = g [^] (- int x)"  
    by (simp add: int_pow_int int_pow_neg assms)
  moreover have "g [^] (order G - (x :: nat)) = g [^] (- int x)"
  proof-
    have "g [^] ((order G - (x :: nat)) mod (order G)) = g [^] ((- int x) mod (order G))" 
    proof-
      have "(order G - (x :: nat)) mod (order G) = (- int x) mod (order G)" 
        using assms(2) zmod_zminus1_eq_if by auto
      thus ?thesis 
        by (metis int_pow_int)
    qed
    thus ?thesis 
    proof -
      have f1: "âˆ€a. a [^] int 0 = ğŸ­"
        by simp
      have f2: "âˆ€n na. ((na::nat) + n) mod na = n mod na"
        by simp
        have f3: "âˆ€a aa. aa âŠ— a [^] int 0 = aa âˆ¨ aa âˆ‰ carrier G"
          by force
        have f4: "âˆ€i a aa. a [^] int 0 âŠ— aa [^] i = aa [^] (int 0 + i) âˆ¨ aa âˆ‰ carrier G"
          by force
        have "âˆ€n a. a [^] int (n * 0) = a [^] (int 0 + int 0) âˆ¨ a âˆ‰ carrier G"
          by simp
        then have f5: "âˆ€a aa. aa [^] int (order G) = a [^] int 0 âˆ¨ aa âˆ‰ carrier G"
          using f4 f3 f2 f1 by (metis int_pow_closed int_pow_int mod_mult_self2 pow_carrier_mod)
        have "âˆ€n na. int (n - na) = - int na + int n âˆ¨ Â¬ na â‰¤ n"
          by auto
        then show ?thesis
          using f5 f3 by (metis assms(1) assms(2) int_pow_closed int_pow_int int_pow_mult less_imp_le_nat)
      qed
    qed
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma int_nat_pow: assumes "a â‰¥ 0" shows "(â™g [^] (int (a ::nat))) [^] (b::int)  = â™g [^] (a*b)"
  using assms 
proof(cases "a >0")
  case True 
  show ?thesis
    using int_pow_pow by blast
next case False
  have "(â™g [^] (int (a ::nat))) [^] (b::int) = ğŸ­" using False by simp
  also have "â™g [^] (a*b) = ğŸ­" using False by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma pow_gen_mod_mult:
  shows"(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) [^] ((c::int)*int (d::nat)) = (â™g [^] a âŠ— â™g [^] b) [^] ((c*int d) mod (order G))"
proof-
  have "(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) âˆˆ carrier G" by simp
  then obtain n :: nat where n: "â™g [^] n = (â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat))" 
    by (simp add: monoid.nat_pow_mult)
  also obtain r where r: "r = c*int d" by simp
  have 1: "(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) [^] ((c::int)*int (d::nat)) = (â™g [^] n) [^] r" using n r by simp
  also have 2:"... = (â™g [^] n) [^] (r mod (order G))" using pow_generator_mod_int pow_generator_mod 
    by (metis int_nat_pow int_pow_int mod_mult_right_eq zero_le)
  also have 3:"... =  (â™g [^] a âŠ— â™g [^] b) [^] ((c*int d) mod (order G))" using r n by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis using 1 2 3 by simp
qed

lemma cyclic_group_commute: assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G" shows "a âŠ— b = b âŠ— a"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  obtain n :: nat where n: "a = â™g [^] n" using generatorE assms by auto
  also  obtain k :: nat where k: "b = â™g [^] k" using generatorE assms by auto
  ultimately have "?lhs =  â™g [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] k" by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (n + k)" by(simp add: nat_pow_mult)
  then have "... = â™g [^] (k + n)" by(simp add: add.commute)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: nat_pow_mult n k)
qed

lemma cyclic_group_assoc: 
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G" "c âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "(a âŠ— b) âŠ— c = a âŠ— (b âŠ— c)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  obtain n :: nat where n: "a = â™g [^] n" using generatorE assms by auto
  obtain k :: nat where k: "b = â™g [^] k" using generatorE assms by auto
  obtain j :: nat where j: "c = â™g [^] j" using generatorE assms by auto 
  have "?lhs = (â™g [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] k) âŠ— â™g [^] j" using n k j by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (n + (k + j))" by(simp add: nat_pow_mult add.assoc)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: nat_pow_mult n k j)
qed
 
lemma l_cancel_inv: 
  assumes "h âˆˆ carrier G" 
  shows "(â™g [^] (a :: nat) âŠ— inv (â™g [^] a)) âŠ— h = h"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have "?lhs = (â™g [^] int a âŠ— inv (â™g [^] int a)) âŠ— h" by simp
  then have "... = (â™g [^] int a âŠ— (â™g [^] (- a))) âŠ— h" using int_pow_neg[symmetric] by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (int a - a)  âŠ— h" by(simp add: int_pow_mult)
  then have "... = â™g [^] ((0:: int)) âŠ— h" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: assms)
qed

lemma inverse_split: 
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" and "b âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "inv (a âŠ— b) = inv a âŠ— inv b"
  by (simp add:  assms comm_group.inv_mult cyclic_group_commute group_comm_groupI)

lemma inverse_pow_pow:
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "inv (a [^] (r::nat)) = (inv a) [^] r"
proof -
  have "a [^] r âˆˆ carrier G"
    using assms by blast
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: assms nat_pow_inv)
qed

lemma l_neq_1_exp_neq_0:
  assumes "l âˆˆ carrier G" 
    and "l â‰  ğŸ­" 
    and "l = â™g [^] (t::nat)" 
  shows "t â‰  0"
proof(rule ccontr)
  assume "Â¬ (t â‰  0)"
  hence "t = 0" by simp
  hence "â™g [^] t = ğŸ­" by simp
  then show "False" using assms by simp
qed

lemma order_gt_1_gen_not_1:
  assumes "order G > 1"
  shows "â™g â‰  ğŸ­"
proof(rule ccontr)
  assume "Â¬ â™g â‰  ğŸ­"
  hence "â™g = ğŸ­" by simp
  hence g_pow_eq_1: "â™g [^] n = ğŸ­" for n :: nat by simp
  hence "range (Î»n :: nat. â™g [^] n) = {ğŸ­}" by auto
  hence "carrier G âŠ† {ğŸ­}" using generator by auto
  hence "order G < 1" 
    by (metis inj_onD inj_on_generator lessThan_iff g_pow_eq_1 assms less_one neq0_conv)
  with assms show "False" by simp
qed

lemma power_swap: "((â™g [^] (Î±0::nat)) [^] (r::nat)) = ((â™g [^] r) [^] Î±0)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have "?lhs = â™g [^] (Î±0 * r)" using nat_pow_pow mult.commute by auto
  hence "... = â™g [^] (r * Î±0)" by(metis mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis using nat_pow_pow by auto
qed

lemma gen_power_0:
  fixes r :: nat 
  assumes "â™g [^] r = ğŸ­" 
    and "r < order G"
  shows "r = 0" 
  using assms inj_onD inj_on_generator by fastforce

lemma group_eq_pow_eq_mod: 
  fixes a b :: nat 
  assumes "â™g [^] a = â™g [^] b" 
    and "order G > 0"
  shows "[a = b] (mod order G)"
proof(cases "a > b")
  case True
  have "â™g [^] a âŠ— inv (â™g [^] b) = ğŸ­"
    using assms by simp
  hence "â™g [^] (a - b) = ğŸ­" 
    by (smt True add_Suc_right assms diff_add_inverse generator_closed group.l_cancel_one' group_l_invI l_inv_ex less_imp_Suc_add nat_pow_closed nat_pow_mult)
  hence "â™g [^] ((a - b) mod (order G)) = ğŸ­" using pow_generator_mod by auto
  thus ?thesis using gen_power_0 
    using assms(1) assms(2) order_gt_0_iff_finite pow_generator_eq_iff_cong by blast
next
  case False
  have "â™g [^] a âŠ— inv (â™g [^] b) = ğŸ­"
    using assms by simp
  hence "â™g [^] (b - a) = ğŸ­" 
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) False Group.group.axioms(1) Units_eq add_diff_inverse_nat assms(1) generator_closed group_l_invI l_inv_ex l_neq_1_exp_neq_0 monoid.Units_l_cancel nat_pow_closed nat_pow_mult r_one)
  hence "â™g [^] ((b - a) mod (order G)) = ğŸ­" using pow_generator_mod by simp
  thus ?thesis using gen_power_0 
    using assms(1) assms(2) order_gt_0_iff_finite pow_generator_eq_iff_cong by blast
qed


end 

end

Theory Discrete_Log

theory Discrete_Log imports 
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
  Cyclic_Group_Ext
begin 

locale dis_log = 
  fixes ğ’¢ :: "'grp cyclic_group" (structure)
  assumes order_gt_0 [simp]: "order ğ’¢ > 0"
begin

type_synonym 'grp' dislog_adv = "'grp' â‡’ nat spmf"

type_synonym 'grp' dislog_adv' = "'grp' â‡’ (nat Ã— nat) spmf"

type_synonym 'grp' dislog_adv2 = "'grp' Ã— 'grp' â‡’ nat spmf"

definition dis_log :: "'grp dislog_adv â‡’ bool spmf"
where "dis_log ğ’œ = TRY do {
  x â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
  let h = â™g [^] x; 
  x'â† ğ’œ h;
  return_spmf ([x = x'] (mod order ğ’¢))} ELSE return_spmf False"

definition advantage :: "'grp dislog_adv â‡’ real"
where "advantage ğ’œ â‰¡ spmf (dis_log ğ’œ) True" 

lemma lossless_dis_log: "âŸ¦0 < order ğ’¢; âˆ€ h. lossless_spmf (ğ’œ h)âŸ§ âŸ¹ lossless_spmf (dis_log ğ’œ)"
by(auto simp add:  dis_log_def)

end 

locale dis_log_alt = 
  fixes ğ’¢ :: "'grp cyclic_group" (structure)
    and x :: nat
  assumes order_gt_0 [simp]: "order ğ’¢ > 0"
begin

sublocale dis_log: dis_log ğ’¢
  unfolding dis_log_def by simp

definition "g' = â™g [^] x"

definition dis_log2 :: "'grp dis_log.dislog_adv' â‡’ bool spmf"
where "dis_log2 ğ’œ = TRY do {
    w â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let h = â™g [^] w;
    (w1',w2') â† ğ’œ h;
    return_spmf ([w = (w1' + x * w2')]  (mod (order ğ’¢)))} ELSE return_spmf False"

definition advantage2 :: "'grp dis_log.dislog_adv' â‡’ real"
where "advantage2 ğ’œ â‰¡ spmf (dis_log2 ğ’œ) True" 

definition adversary2 :: "('grp â‡’ (nat Ã— nat) spmf) â‡’ 'grp â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "adversary2 ğ’œ h = do {
    (w1,w2) â† ğ’œ h;
    return_spmf (w1 + x * w2)}"

  where "advantage3 ğ’œ â‰¡ spmf (dis_log3 ğ’œ) True"

    ğ’œ (g, g [^] x)}"

Theory Number_Theory_Aux

theory Number_Theory_Aux imports
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Residues"
begin

abbreviation inverse where "inverse x q â‰¡ (fst (bezw x q))"

lemma inverse: assumes "gcd x q = 1" 
  shows "[x * inverse x q = 1] (mod q)"
proof-
  have 2: "fst (bezw x q) * x + snd (bezw x q) * int q = 1" 
    using bezw_aux assms int_minus 
    by (metis Num.of_nat_simps(2)) 
  hence 3: "(fst (bezw x q) * x + snd (bezw x q) * int q) mod q = 1 mod q" 
    by (metis assms bezw_aux of_nat_mod)
  hence 4: "(fst (bezw x q) * x) mod q = 1 mod q"
    by simp 
  hence 5:  "[(fst (bezw x q)) * x  = 1] (mod q)" 
    using 2 3 cong_def by force 
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: mult.commute) 
qed

lemma prod_not_prime: 
  assumes "prime (x::nat)" 
    and "prime y" 
    and "x > 2" 
    and "y > 2" 
  shows "Â¬ prime ((x-1)*(y-1))"
  by (metis assms One_nat_def Suc_diff_1 nat_neq_iff numeral_2_eq_2 prime_gt_0_nat prime_product)

lemma ex_inverse:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and "prime P" 
    and "prime Q"   
    and "P â‰  Q" 
  shows "âˆƒ d. [e*d = 1] (mod (P-1)) âˆ§ d â‰  0"
proof-
  have "coprime e (P-1)" 
    using assms(1) by simp 
  then obtain d where d: "[e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))" 
    using cong_solve_coprime_nat by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis cong_0_1_nat cong_1 mult_0_right zero_neq_one)
qed

lemma ex_k1_k2:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and " [e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))"
  shows "âˆƒ k1 k2. e*d + k1*(P-1) = 1 + k2*(P-1)"
  by (metis assms(2) cong_iff_lin_nat)
lemma "a > b âŸ¹int a - int b = int (a - b)" 
  by simp

lemma ex_k_mod:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and "P â‰  Q"
    and "prime P"
    and "prime Q"
    and "d â‰  0"
    and " [e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))"
  shows "âˆƒ k. e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)"
proof-
  have "e > 0"  
    using assms(1) assms(2) prime_gt_0_nat by fastforce
  then have "e*d â‰¥ 1" using assms by simp
  then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)" 
    using assms(6) cong_to_1'_nat by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma fermat_little_theorem:
  assumes "prime (P :: nat)" 
  shows "[x^P = x] (mod P)" 
proof(cases "P dvd x")
  case True
  hence "x mod P = 0" by simp
  moreover have "x ^ P mod P = 0" 
    by (simp add: True assms prime_dvd_power_nat_iff prime_gt_0_nat)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: cong_def)
next
  case False
  hence "[x ^ (P - 1) = 1] (mod P)" using fermat_theorem assms by blast
  then show ?thesis  
    by (metis Suc_diff_1 assms cong_scalar_left nat_mult_1_right not_gr_zero not_prime_0 power_Suc)
qed

lemma prime_field:
  assumes "prime (q::nat)" 
    and "a < q" 
    and "a â‰  0"
  shows "coprime a q"
  by (meson assms coprime_commute dvd_imp_le linorder_not_le neq0_conv prime_imp_coprime)

end

Theory Uniform_Sampling

theory Uniform_Sampling imports

definition sample_uniform_units :: "nat â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "sample_uniform_units q = spmf_of_set ({..< q} - {0})"

lemma set_spmf_sample_uniform_units [simp]:
  "set_spmf (sample_uniform_units q) = {..< q} - {0}" 
  by(simp add: sample_uniform_units_def)

lemma lossless_sample_uniform_units:
  assumes "(p::nat) > 1" 
  shows "lossless_spmf (sample_uniform_units p)" 
  unfolding sample_uniform_units_def
  using assms by auto

lemma weight_sample_uniform_units:
  assumes "(p::nat) > 1" 
  shows "weight_spmf (sample_uniform_units p) = 1"
  using assms lossless_sample_uniform_units 
  by (simp add: lossless_weight_spmfD)

(*General lemma for mapping using sample_uniform*)

lemma one_time_pad': 
  assumes inj_on: "inj_on f ({..<q} - {0})" 
    and sur: "f ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"  
  shows "map_spmf f (sample_uniform_units q) = (sample_uniform_units q)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set (({..<q} - {0}))" 
    by(auto simp add: sample_uniform_units_def)
  also have "map_spmf(Î»s. f s) (spmf_of_set ({..<q} - {0})) = spmf_of_set ((Î»s. f s) ` ({..<q} - {0}))"
    by(simp add: inj_on)
  also have "f ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj) by(simp, simp add: sur, simp add: inj_on)
  ultimately show ?thesis using rhs by simp
qed

lemma one_time_pad: 
  assumes inj_on: "inj_on f {..<q}" 
    and sur: "f ` {..<q} = {..<q}"  
  shows "map_spmf f (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set ({..< q})" 
    by(auto simp add: sample_uniform_def)
  also have "map_spmf(Î»s. f s) (spmf_of_set {..<q}) = spmf_of_set ((Î»s. f s) ` {..<q})"
    by(simp add: inj_on)
  also have "f ` {..<q} = {..<q}"
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj) by(simp, simp add: sur, simp add: inj_on)
  ultimately show ?thesis using rhs by simp
qed

(*(y + b)*)

lemma plus_inj_eq: 
  assumes x: "x < q"
    and x': "x' < q" 
    and map: "((y :: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q"  
shows "x = x'"
proof-
  have "((y :: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q âŸ¹ x mod q = x' mod q"
  proof-
    have "((y:: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q âŸ¹ [((y:: nat) + x) = (y + x')] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    moreover have "[((y:: nat) + x) = (y + x')] (mod q) âŸ¹ [x = x'] (mod q)"
      by (simp add: cong_add_lcancel_nat)
    moreover have "[x = x'] (mod q) âŸ¹ x mod q = x' mod q"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
  qed
  moreover have "x mod q = x' mod q âŸ¹ x = x'"
    by(simp add: x x')
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map) 
qed

lemma inj_uni_samp_plus: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q ) {..<q}" 
  by(simp add: inj_on_def)(auto simp only: plus_inj_eq)

lemma surj_uni_samp_plus: 
  assumes inj: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q ) {..<q}" 
  shows "(Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q) ` {..< q} =  {..< q}" 
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using inj by auto

lemma samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad: 
shows "map_spmf (Î»b. (y + b) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = sample_uniform q"
  using inj_uni_samp_plus surj_uni_samp_plus one_time_pad by simp

(*x*b*) 

lemma mult_inj_eq: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and y: "y < q" 
    and y': "y' < q" 
    and map: "x * y mod q = x * y' mod q" 
  shows "y = y'"
proof-
  have "x*y mod q = x*y' mod q âŸ¹ y mod q = y' mod q"
  proof-
    have "x*y mod q = x*y' mod q âŸ¹ [x*y = x*y'] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    moreover have "[x*y = x*y'] (mod q) = [y = y'] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_mult_lcancel_nat coprime)
    moreover have "[y = y'] (mod q) âŸ¹ y mod q = y' mod q"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
  qed
  moreover have "y mod q = y' mod q âŸ¹ y = y'"
    by(simp add: y y')
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map) 
qed

lemma inj_on_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
  shows "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) {..<q}"
  apply(auto simp add: inj_on_def)
  using coprime by(simp only: mult_inj_eq)

  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and inj: "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) {..<q}"
  shows "(Î» b. x*b mod q) ` {..< q} = {..< q}"
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using coprime inj by auto

  shows "map_spmf (Î» b. x*b mod q) (sample_uniform q) = sample_uniform q"
  using inj_on_mult surj_on_mult one_time_pad coprime by simp


lemma inj_on_mult':
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
  shows "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})"
  apply(auto simp add: inj_on_def)
  using coprime by(simp only: mult_inj_eq)

lemma surj_on_mult': 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and inj: "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})"
  shows "(Î» b. x*b mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"
proof(rule endo_inj_surj) 
  show " finite ({..<q} - {0})" by auto
  show "(Î»b. x * b mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}"  
  proof-
    obtain nn :: "nat set â‡’ (nat â‡’ nat) â‡’ nat set â‡’ nat" where
      "âˆ€x0 x1 x2. (âˆƒv3. v3 âˆˆ x2 âˆ§ x1 v3 âˆ‰ x0) = (nn x0 x1 x2 âˆˆ x2 âˆ§ x1 (nn x0 x1 x2) âˆ‰ x0)"
        by moura
    hence 1: "âˆ€N f Na. nn Na f N âˆˆ N âˆ§ f (nn Na f N) âˆ‰ Na âˆ¨ f ` N âŠ† Na"
      by (meson image_subsetI)
    have 2: "x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆ‰ {..<q} âˆ¨ x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q}"
      by force
    have 3: "(x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q} - {0}) = (x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0})"
      by simp 
    { assume "x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q = x * 0 mod q" 
      hence "(0 â‰¤ q) = (0 = q) âˆ¨ (nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} âˆ¨ nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆˆ {0}) âˆ¨ nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0}"
        by (metis antisym_conv1 insertCI lessThan_iff local.coprime mult_inj_eq) } 
    moreover
    { assume "0 â‰  x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q"
      moreover 
      { assume "x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q} âˆ§ x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆ‰ {0}"
        hence "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}"
          using 3 1 by (meson Diff_iff) } 
      ultimately have "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ (0 â‰¤ q) = (0 = q)"
        using 2 by (metis antisym_conv1 lessThan_iff mod_less_divisor singletonD) } 
    ultimately have "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ x * nn ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0}"
      by force 
    thus "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}"
      using 1 by meson 
  qed
  show "inj_on (Î»b. x * b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})" 
    using inj by blast
qed

lemma mult_one_time_pad':
  assumes coprime: "coprime x q" 
  shows "map_spmf (Î» b. x*b mod q) (sample_uniform_units q) = sample_uniform_units q"

(*y + x*b*)

lemma samp_uni_add_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and x': "x' < q" 
    and y': "y' < q" 
    and map: "(y + x * x') mod q = (y + x * y') mod q" 
  shows "x' = y'"
proof-
  have "(y + x * x') mod q = (y + x * y') mod q âŸ¹ x' mod q = y' mod q"
  proof-
  have "(y + x * x') mod q = (y + x * y') mod q âŸ¹ [y + x*x' = y + x *y'] (mod q)"
    using cong_def by blast
  moreover have "[y + x*x' = y + x *y'] (mod q) âŸ¹ [x' = y'] (mod q)"
    by(simp add: cong_add_lcancel_nat)(simp add: coprime cong_mult_lcancel_nat)
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: cong_def map)
  qed
  moreover have "x' mod q = y' mod q âŸ¹ x' = y'"
    by(simp add: x' y')
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
qed

lemma inj_on_add_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
  shows "inj_on (Î» b. (y + x*b) mod q) {..<q}"

(*(y - b) *)

lemma inj_on_minus: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q ) {..<q}"
proof(unfold inj_on_def; auto)
  fix x :: nat and y' :: nat
  assume x: "x < q"
  assume y': "y' < q"
  assume map: "(y + q - x) mod q = (y + q - y') mod q"
  have "âˆ€n na p. âˆƒnb. âˆ€nc nd pa. (Â¬ (nc::nat) < nd âˆ¨ Â¬ pa (nc - nd) âˆ¨ pa 0) âˆ§ (Â¬ p (0::nat) âˆ¨ p (n - na) âˆ¨ na + nb = n)"
    by (metis (no_types) nat_diff_split)
  hence "Â¬ y < y' - q âˆ§ Â¬ y < x - q"
    using y' x by (metis add.commute less_diff_conv not_add_less2)
  hence "âˆƒn. (y' + n) mod q = (n + x) mod q"
    using map by (metis add.commute add_diff_inverse_nat less_diff_conv mod_add_left_eq)
  thus "x = y'" 
    by (metis plus_inj_eq  x y' add.commute)
qed

lemma surj_on_minus: 
  assumes inj: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q ) {..<q}" 
  shows "(Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q) ` {..< q} = {..< q}"
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using inj by auto

  shows "map_spmf(Î» b. (y + (q - b)) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = sample_uniform q"
  using inj_on_minus surj_on_minus one_time_pad by simp

lemma not_coin_spmf: "map_spmf (Î» a. Â¬ a) coin_spmf = coin_spmf" 
proof-
  have "inj_on Not {True, False}" 
    by simp
  moreover have  "Not ` {True, False} = {True, False}" 
    by auto 
  ultimately show ?thesis using one_time_pad 
    by (simp add: UNIV_bool)
qed

lemma xor_uni_samp: "map_spmf(Î» b. y âŠ• b) (coin_spmf) = map_spmf(Î» b. b) (coin_spmf)"
  (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set {True, False}"
    by (simp add: UNIV_bool insert_commute)
  also have "map_spmf(Î» b. y âŠ• b) (spmf_of_set {True, False}) = spmf_of_set((Î» b. y âŠ• b) ` {True, False})"
    by (simp add: xor_def)
  also have "(Î» b. xor y b) ` {True, False} = {True, False}"
    using xor_def by auto
  finally show ?thesis using rhs by(simp)
qed

lemma ped_inv_mapping:
  assumes "(a::nat) < q"
    and "[m â‰  0] (mod q)"
  shows "map_spmf (Î» d. (d + a * (m::nat)) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = map_spmf (Î» d. (d + q * m - a * m) mod q) (sample_uniform q)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have ineq: "q * m - a * m > 0" 
    using assms gr0I by force
  have "?lhs = map_spmf (Î» d. (a * m + d) mod q) (sample_uniform q)" 
    using add.commute by metis
  also have "... = sample_uniform q"
    using samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad by simp
  also have "... = map_spmf (Î» d. ((q * m - a * m) + d) mod q) (sample_uniform q)"
    using ineq samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad by metis
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    using add.commute ineq  
    by (simp add: Groups.add_ac(2))
qed

end

Theory Pedersen

subsectionâ€¹Pedersen Commitment Schemeâ€º

textâ€¹The Pedersen commitment scheme \cite{BLP:conf/crypto/Pedersen91} is a commitment scheme based on a cyclic group. We use the 
construction of cyclic groups from CryptHOL to formalise the commitment scheme. We prove perfect hiding
and computational binding, with a reduction to the discrete log problem. We a proof of the Pedersen commitment scheme
is realised in the instantiation of the Schnorr â€¹Î£â€º-protocol with the general construction of commitment schemes 
from â€¹Î£â€º-protocols. The commitment scheme that is realised there however take the inverse of the message in the commitment 
phase due to the construction of the simulator in the â€¹Î£â€º-protocol proof. The two schemes are in some way equal however
as we do not have a well defined notion of equality for commitment schemes we keep this section of the formalisation. This 
also serves as reference to the formal proof of the Pedersen commitment scheme we provide in \cite{DBLP:conf/post/ButlerAG19}.â€º

theory Pedersen imports
  Commitment_Schemes
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
  Cyclic_Group_Ext
  Discrete_Log
  Number_Theory_Aux
  Uniform_Sampling
begin

locale pedersen_base = 
  fixes ğ’¢ :: "'grp cyclic_group" (structure)
  assumes prime_order: "prime (order ğ’¢)"
begin

lemma order_gt_0 [simp]: "order ğ’¢ > 0"
  by (simp add: prime_gt_0_nat prime_order)

type_synonym 'grp' ck = "'grp'"
type_synonym 'grp' vk = "'grp'"
type_synonym plain = "nat"
type_synonym 'grp' commit = "'grp'"
type_synonym "opening" = "nat"

definition key_gen :: "('grp ck Ã— 'grp vk) spmf"
where 
  "key_gen = do {
    x :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let h = â™g [^] x;
    return_spmf (h, h) 
  }" 

definition commit :: "'grp ck â‡’ plain â‡’ ('grp commit Ã— opening) spmf"
where 
  "commit ck m = do {
    d :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let c = (â™g [^] d) âŠ— (ck [^] m);
    return_spmf (c,d) 
  }"

definition commit_inv :: "'grp ck â‡’ plain â‡’ ('grp commit Ã— opening) spmf"
where 
  "commit_inv ck m = do {
    d :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let c = (â™g [^] d) âŠ— (inv ck [^] m);
    return_spmf (c,d) 
  }"

definition verify :: "'grp vk â‡’ plain â‡’ 'grp commit â‡’ opening â‡’ bool"
where 
  "verify v_key m c d = (c = (â™g [^] d âŠ—  v_key [^] m))"

definition valid_msg :: "plain â‡’ bool"
  where "valid_msg msg â‰¡ (msg < order ğ’¢)"

definition dis_log_ğ’œ :: "('grp ck, plain, 'grp commit, opening) bind_adversary â‡’ 'grp ck â‡’ nat spmf"
where "dis_log_ğ’œ ğ’œ h = do {
  (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ h;
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m'  âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (c = â™g [^] d âŠ— h [^] m âˆ§ c = â™g [^] d' âŠ— h [^] m'); 
  return_spmf  (if (m > m') then (nat ((int d' - int d) * inverse (m - m') (order ğ’¢) mod order ğ’¢)) else 
                  (nat ((int d - int d') * inverse (m' - m) (order ğ’¢) mod order ğ’¢)))}"

lemma mod_one_cancel: assumes "[int y * z * x = y' * x] (mod order ğ’¢)" and "[z * x = 1] (mod order ğ’¢)"
  shows "[int y = y' * x] (mod order ğ’¢)"
  by (metis assms Groups.mult_ac(2) cong_scalar_right cong_sym_eq cong_trans more_arith_simps(11) more_arith_simps(5))

lemma dis_log_break:
  fixes d d' m m' :: nat
  assumes c: " â™g [^] d' âŠ— (â™g [^] y) [^] m' = â™g [^] d âŠ— (â™g [^] y) [^] m"
    and y_less_order: "y < order ğ’¢"
    and m_ge_m': "m > m'"
    and m: "m < order ğ’¢"
  shows "y = nat ((int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢))) mod order ğ’¢)" 
proof -
  have mm': "Â¬ [m = m'] (mod order ğ’¢)"
    using m m_ge_m' basic_trans_rules(19) cong_less_modulus_unique_nat by blast
  hence gcd: "int (gcd ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)) = 1" 
    using assms(3) assms(4) prime_field prime_order by auto
  have "â™g [^] (d + y * m) = â™g [^] (d' + y * m')" 
    using c by (simp add: nat_pow_mult nat_pow_pow)
  hence "[d + y * m = d' + y * m'] (mod order ğ’¢)"
    by(simp add: pow_generator_eq_iff_cong finite_carrier)
  hence "[int d + int y * int m = int d' + int y * int m'] (mod order ğ’¢)" 
    using cong_int_iff by force
  from cong_diff[OF this cong_refl, of "int d + int y * int m'"]
  have "[int y * int (m - m') = int d' - int d] (mod order ğ’¢)" using m_ge_m'
    by(simp add: int_distrib of_nat_diff)
  hence *: "[int y * int (m - m') * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢))) = (int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)))] (mod order ğ’¢)"
    by (simp add: cong_scalar_right)
  hence "[int y * (int (m - m') * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)))) = (int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)))] (mod order ğ’¢)"
    by (simp add: more_arith_simps(11))
  hence "[int y * 1 = (int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)))] (mod order ğ’¢)"
    using inverse gcd 
    by (smt Groups.mult_ac(2) Number_Theory_Aux.inverse Totient.of_nat_eq_1_iff * cong_def int_ops(9) mod_mult_right_eq mod_one_cancel)
  hence "[int y = (int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢)))] (mod order ğ’¢)" by simp
  hence "y mod order ğ’¢ = (int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢))) mod order ğ’¢"
    using cong_def zmod_int by auto
  thus ?thesis using y_less_order by simp
qed

lemma dis_log_break':
  assumes "y < order ğ’¢"
    and "Â¬ m' < m"
    and "m â‰  m'"
    and m: "m' < order ğ’¢"
    and "â™g [^] d âŠ— (â™g [^] y) [^] m = â™g [^] d' âŠ— (â™g [^] y) [^] m'"
  shows "y = nat ((int d - int d') * fst (bezw ((m' - m)) (order ğ’¢)) mod int (order ğ’¢))"
proof-
  have "m' > m" using assms 
    using group_eq_pow_eq_mod nat_neq_iff order_gt_0  by blast
  thus ?thesis 
    using dis_log_break[of d y m d' m' ]assms cong_sym_eq assms by blast  
qed

lemma set_spmf_samp_uni [simp]: "set_spmf (sample_uniform (order ğ’¢)) = {x. x < order ğ’¢}"
  by(auto simp add: sample_uniform_def)

lemma perfect_hiding:
  shows "spmf (ped_commit.hiding_game_ind_cpa ğ’œ) True - 1/2 = 0"
  including monad_normalisation
proof -
  obtain ğ’œ1 ğ’œ2 where [simp]: "ğ’œ = (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2)" by(cases ğ’œ)
  note [simp] = Let_def split_def

  also have "... = TRY do {

  also have "... = TRY do {

      by(simp add: bind_map_spmf o_def)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let h = (â™g [^] x);

  also have "... = TRY do {
    x :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    let h = (â™g [^] x);
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 h;

lemma bind_game_eq_dis_log:
  shows "ped_commit.bind_game ğ’œ = discrete_log.dis_log (dis_log_ğ’œ ğ’œ)"
proof-
  note [simp] = Let_def split_def
  have "ped_commit.bind_game ğ’œ = TRY do {
    (ck,vk) â† key_gen;
    (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ ck;
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf(m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m'); 
    let b = verify vk m c d;
    let b' = verify vk m' c d';
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (b âˆ§ b');
    return_spmf True} ELSE return_spmf False" 
    by(simp add: abstract_commitment.bind_game_alt_def) 
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x :: nat â† sample_uniform (Coset.order ğ’¢);
    (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ (â™g [^] x);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m'); 
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (c = â™g [^] d âŠ—  (â™g [^] x) [^] m âˆ§ c = â™g [^] d' âŠ— (â™g [^] x) [^] m');
    return_spmf True} ELSE return_spmf False" 
    by(simp add: verify_def key_gen_def)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x :: nat â† sample_uniform (order ğ’¢);
    (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ (â™g [^] x);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m'); 
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (c = â™g [^] d âŠ—  (â™g [^] x) [^] m âˆ§ c = â™g [^] d' âŠ— (â™g [^] x) [^] m');
    return_spmf (x = (if (m > m') then (nat ((int d' - int d) * (fst (bezw ((m - m')) (order ğ’¢))) mod order ğ’¢)) else 
                  (nat ((int d - int d') * (fst (bezw ((m' - m)) (order ğ’¢))) mod order ğ’¢))))} ELSE return_spmf False" 
    apply(intro try_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)
     apply(auto simp add: valid_msg_def)
     apply(intro bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)+
     apply(simp add: dis_log_break)
    apply(intro bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)+
    by(simp add: dis_log_break')
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    apply(simp add: discrete_log.dis_log_def dis_log_ğ’œ_def cong: bind_spmf_cong_simp)
    apply(intro try_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)+
    using bind_output_cong by auto
qed

Theory Rivest

subsectionâ€¹Rivest Commitment Schemeâ€º

textâ€¹The Rivest commitment scheme was first introduced in \cite{rivest1999}. We note however the original
scheme did not allow for perfect hiding. This was pointed out by Blundo and Masucci in \cite{DBLP:journals/dcc/BlundoMSW02}
who alightly ammended the commitment scheme so that is provided perfect hiding.

The Rivest commitment scheme uses a trusted initialiser to provide correlated randomness to the two parties 
before an execution of the protocol. In our framework we set these as keys that held by the respective parties.â€º

theory Rivest imports
  Commitment_Schemes
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
  Cyclic_Group_Ext
  Discrete_Log
  Number_Theory_Aux
  Uniform_Sampling
begin

locale rivest = 
  fixes q :: nat
  assumes prime_q: "prime q"
begin

lemma q_gt_0 [simp]: "q > 0" 
  by (simp add: prime_q prime_gt_0_nat)

type_synonym ck = "nat Ã— nat"
type_synonym vk = "nat Ã— nat"
type_synonym plain = "nat"
type_synonym commit = "nat"
type_synonym "opening" = "nat Ã— nat"

definition key_gen :: "(ck Ã— vk) spmf"
  where 
    "key_gen = do {
    a :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    b :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    let y1 = (a * x1 + b) mod q;
    return_spmf ((a,b), (x1,y1))}" 

definition commit :: "ck â‡’ plain â‡’ (commit Ã— opening) spmf"
  where 
    "commit ck m = do {
  let (a,b) = ck;
  return_spmf ((m + a) mod q, (a,b))}"

fun verify :: "vk â‡’ plain â‡’ commit â‡’ opening â‡’ bool"
  where 
    "verify (x1,y1) m c (a,b) = (((c = (m + a) mod q)) âˆ§ (y1 = (a * x1 + b) mod q))"

definition valid_msg :: "plain â‡’ bool"
  where "valid_msg msg â‰¡ msg âˆˆ {..< q}"

sublocale rivest_commit: abstract_commitment key_gen commit verify valid_msg .

lemma abstract_correct: "rivest_commit.correct"
  unfolding abstract_commitment.correct_def abstract_commitment.correct_game_def
  by(simp add: key_gen_def commit_def bind_spmf_const lossless_weight_spmfD)

lemma rivest_hiding: "(spmf (rivest_commit.hiding_game_ind_cpa ğ’œ) True - 1/2 = 0)"
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
  note [simp] = Let_def split_def 
  obtain ğ’œ1 ğ’œ2 where [simp]: "ğ’œ = (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2)" by(cases ğ’œ)
  have "rivest_commit.hiding_game_ind_cpa (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2) = TRY do {
    a :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    y1 â† map_spmf (Î» b. (a * x1 + b) mod q) (sample_uniform q);
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x1,y1);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    d â† coin_spmf;  
    let c = ((if d then m0 else m1) + a) mod q;
    b' â† ğ’œ2 c Ïƒ;
    return_spmf (b' = d)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    unfolding abstract_commitment.hiding_game_ind_cpa_def
    by(simp add: commit_def key_gen_def o_def bind_map_spmf)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    a :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    y1 â† sample_uniform q;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x1,y1);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    d â† coin_spmf;  
    let c = ((if d then m0 else m1) + a) mod q;
    b' â† ğ’œ2 c Ïƒ;
    return_spmf (b' = d)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    by(simp add: samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    y1 â† sample_uniform q;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x1,y1);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    d â† coin_spmf;  
    c â† map_spmf (Î» a. ((if d then m0 else m1) + a) mod q) (sample_uniform q);
    b' â† ğ’œ2 c Ïƒ;
    return_spmf (b' = d)} ELSE coin_spmf" 
    by(simp add: o_def bind_map_spmf)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    y1 â† sample_uniform q;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x1,y1);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    d â† coin_spmf;

    by(simp add: samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    y1 â† sample_uniform q;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x1,y1);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    c :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    guess :: bool â† ğ’œ2 c Ïƒ;
    map_spmf((=) guess) coin_spmf} ELSE coin_spmf"
    by(simp add: map_spmf_conv_bind_spmf)
  also have "... = coin_spmf" 
    by(simp add: map_eq_const_coin_spmf bind_spmf_const try_bind_spmf_lossless2' 
        scale_bind_spmf weight_spmf_le_1 scale_scale_spmf)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by(simp add: spmf_of_set)
qed

lemma rivest_perfect_hiding: "rivest_commit.perfect_hiding_ind_cpa ğ’œ"
  unfolding abstract_commitment.perfect_hiding_ind_cpa_def abstract_commitment.hiding_advantage_ind_cpa_def
  by(simp add: rivest_hiding)

lemma samp_uni_break':
  assumes fst_cond: "m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m'"
    and c: "c = (m + a) mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a * x1 + b) mod q" 
    and  c': "c = (m' + a') mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a' * x1 + b') mod q"
    and x1: "x1 < q" 
  shows "x1 = (if (a mod q > a' mod q) then nat ((int b'- int b) * (inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q) mod q)  else 
          nat ((int b- int b') * (inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q) mod q))"
proof-
  have m: "m < q âˆ§ m' < q" using fst_cond valid_msg_def by simp
  have a_a': "Â¬ [a = a'] (mod q)"
  proof-
    have "[m + a = m' + a'] (mod q)" 
      using assms cong_def by blast
    thus ?thesis 
      by (metis m fst_cond c c' add.commute cong_less_modulus_unique_nat cong_add_rcancel_nat cong_mod_right)
  qed
  have cong_y1: "[int a * int x1 + int b = int a' * int x1 + int b'] (mod q)" 
    by (metis c c' cong_def Num.of_nat_simps(4) Num.of_nat_simps(5) cong_int_iff)
  show ?thesis 
  proof(cases "a mod q > a' mod q")
    case True
    hence gcd: "gcd (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q = 1"
    proof-
      have "((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q) â‰  0" 
        by (metis True comm_monoid_add_class.add_0 diff_add_cancel mod_add_left_eq mod_diff_eq nat_mod_as_int order_less_irrefl)
      moreover have "((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q) < q" by simp   
      ultimately show ?thesis
        using prime_field[of q "nat ((int a mod int q - int a' mod int q) mod int q)"] prime_q 
        by (smt Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_sign coprime_imp_gcd_eq_1 int_nat_eq nat_less_iff of_nat_0_less_iff q_gt_0)
    qed
    hence "[int a * int x1 - int a' * int x1 = int b'- int b] (mod q)"  
      by (smt cong_diff_iff_cong_0 cong_y1 cong_diff cong_diff)
    hence "[int a mod q * int x1 - int a' mod q * int x1 = int b'- int b] (mod q)"  
    proof -
      have "[int x1 * (int a mod int q - int a' mod int q) = int x1 * (int a - int a')] (mod int q)"
        by (meson cong_def cong_mult cong_refl mod_diff_eq)
      then show ?thesis
        by (metis (no_types, hide_lams) Groups.mult_ac(2) â€¹[int a * int x1 - int a' * int x1 = int b' - int b] (mod int q)â€º cong_def mod_diff_left_eq mod_diff_right_eq mod_mult_right_eq)
    qed
    hence "[int x1 * (int a mod q - int a' mod q) = int b'- int b] (mod q)" 
      by(metis int_distrib(3) mult.commute)
    hence "[int x1 * (int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q = int b'- int b] (mod q)"
      using cong_def by simp
    hence "[int x1 * nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q) = int b'- int b] (mod q)"
      by (simp add: True cong_def mod_mult_right_eq)
    hence "[int x1 * nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q 
              = (int b'- int b) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      using cong_scalar_right by blast
    hence "[int x1 * (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q) 
              = (int b'- int b) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      by (simp add: more_arith_simps(11))
    hence "[int x1 * 1 = (int b'- int b) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      using inverse gcd 
      by (meson cong_scalar_left cong_sym_eq cong_trans)
    hence "[int x1 = (int b'- int b) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      by simp
    hence "int x1 mod q = ((int b'- int b) * inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q) mod q"
      using cong_def by fast
    thus ?thesis using x1 True by simp
  next
    case False
    hence aa': "a mod q < a' mod q" 
      using a_a' cong_refl nat_neq_iff 
      by (simp add: cong_def)
    hence gcd: "gcd (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q = 1"
    proof-
      have "((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q) â‰  0" 
        by (metis aa' comm_monoid_add_class.add_0 diff_add_cancel mod_add_left_eq mod_diff_eq nat_mod_as_int order_less_irrefl)
      moreover have "((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q) < q" by simp   
      ultimately show ?thesis
        using prime_field[of q "nat ((int a' mod int q - int a mod int q) mod int q)"] prime_q
        by (smt Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_sign coprime_imp_gcd_eq_1 int_nat_eq nat_less_iff of_nat_0_less_iff q_gt_0) 
    qed
    have "[int b - int b' = int a' * int x1 - int a * int x1] (mod q)"
      by (smt cong_diff_iff_cong_0 cong_y1 cong_diff cong_diff)
    hence "[int b - int b' = int x1 * (int a' - int a)] (mod q)"
      using int_distrib mult.commute by metis
    hence "[int b - int b' = int x1 * (int a' mod q - int a mod q)] (mod q)"
      by (metis (no_types, lifting) cong_def mod_diff_eq mod_mult_right_eq)
    hence "[int b - int b' = int x1 * (int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q] (mod q)"
      using cong_def by simp
    hence "[(int b - int b') * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q 
               = int x1 * (int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q *  inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q ] (mod q)"
      using cong_scalar_right by blast
    hence "[(int b - int b') * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q 
               = int x1 * ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q *  inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q)] (mod q)"
      by (metis (mono_tags, lifting) cong_def mod_mult_left_eq mod_mult_right_eq more_arith_simps(11))
    hence *: "[int x1 * ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q) 
              = (int b - int b') * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      using cong_sym_eq by auto
    hence "[int x1 * 1 = (int b - int b') * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
    proof -
      have "[(int a' mod int q - int a mod int q) mod int q * Number_Theory_Aux.inverse (nat ((int a' mod int q - int a mod int q) mod int q)) q = 1] (mod int q)"
        by (metis (no_types) Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_sign inverse gcd int_nat_eq of_nat_0_less_iff q_gt_0)
      then show ?thesis
        by (meson * cong_scalar_left cong_sym_eq cong_trans)
    qed
    hence "[int x1 = (int b - int b') * inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q] (mod q)"
      by simp
    hence "int x1 mod q = (int b - int b') * (inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q) mod q"
      using cong_def by auto
    thus ?thesis using x1 aa' by simp
  qed
qed


lemma samp_uni_spmf_mod_q:
  shows "spmf (sample_uniform q) (x mod q) = 1/q"
proof-
  have "indicator {..< q} (x mod q) = 1" 
    using q_gt_0 by auto
  moreover have "real (card {..< q}) = q" by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by(auto simp add: spmf_of_set sample_uniform_def)
qed

lemma spmf_samp_uni_eq_return_bool_mod:
  shows "spmf (do { 
          x1 â† sample_uniform q;
          return_spmf (int x1 = y mod q)}) True = 1/q" 
proof-
  have "spmf (do { 
          x1 â† sample_uniform q;
          return_spmf (x1 = y mod q)}) True = spmf (sample_uniform q â¤œ (Î» x1. return_spmf x1)) (y mod q)"
    apply(simp only: spmf_bind)
    apply(rule Bochner_Integration.integral_cong[OF refl])+
  proof -
    fix x :: nat
    have "y mod q = x âŸ¶ indicator {True} (x = (y mod q)) = (indicator {(y mod q)} x::real)"
      by simp
    then have "indicator {True} (x = y mod q) = (indicator {y mod q} x::real)"
      by fastforce
    then show "spmf (return_spmf (x = y mod q)) True = spmf (return_spmf x) (y mod q)"
      by (metis pmf_return spmf_of_pmf_return_pmf spmf_spmf_of_pmf)
  qed 
  thus ?thesis using samp_uni_spmf_mod_q by simp
qed

lemma bind_game_le_inv_q:
  shows "spmf (rivest_commit.bind_game ğ’œ) True â‰¤ 1 / q"
proof -
  let ?eq = "Î»a a' b b'. (=)
   (if (a mod q > a' mod q) then nat ((int b'- int b) * (inverse (nat ((int a mod q - int a' mod q) mod q)) q) mod q)
    else nat ((int b - int b') * (inverse (nat ((int a' mod q - int a mod q) mod q)) q) mod q))"
  have "spmf (rivest_commit.bind_game ğ’œ) True = spmf (do {
    (ck,(x1,y1)) â† key_gen;
    (c, m, (a,b), m', (a',b')) â† ğ’œ ck;
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf(m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');  
    let b = verify (x1,y1) m c (a,b);
    let b' = verify (x1,y1) m' c (a',b');
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (b âˆ§ b');
    return_spmf True}) True" 
    by(simp add: abstract_commitment.bind_game_alt_def split_def spmf_try_spmf del: verify.simps) 
  also have "... = spmf (do {
    a' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    b' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    let y1 = (a' * x1 + b') mod q;
    (c, m, (a,b), m', (a',b')) â† ğ’œ (a',b');
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');  
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (c = (m + a) mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a * x1 + b) mod q âˆ§ c = (m' + a') mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a' * x1 + b') mod q);
    return_spmf True}) True" 
    by(simp add: key_gen_def Let_def)
  also have "... = spmf (do {
    a'' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    b'' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    x1 :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    let y1 = (a'' * x1 + b'') mod q;
    (c, m, (a,b), m', (a',b')) â† ğ’œ (a'',b'');
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ valid_msg m âˆ§ valid_msg m');  
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (c = (m + a) mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a * x1 + b) mod q âˆ§ c = (m' + a') mod q âˆ§ y1 = (a' * x1 + b') mod q);
    return_spmf (?eq a a' b b' x1)}) True" 
    unfolding split_def Let_def
    by(rule arg_cong2[where f=spmf, OF _ refl] bind_spmf_cong[OF refl])+
      (auto simp add: eq_commute samp_uni_break' Let_def split_def valid_msg_def cong: bind_spmf_cong_simp)
  also have "... â‰¤ spmf (do {
    a'' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    b'' :: nat â† sample_uniform q;
    (c, m, (a,(b::nat)), m', (a',b')) â† ğ’œ (a'',b'');
    map_spmf (?eq a a' b b') (sample_uniform q)}) True"
    including monad_normalisation
    unfolding split_def Let_def assert_spmf_def
    apply(simp add: map_spmf_conv_bind_spmf)
    apply(rule ord_spmf_eq_leD ord_spmf_bind_reflI)+
    apply auto
    done
  also have "... â‰¤ 1/q" 
  proof((rule spmf_bind_leI)+, clarify)
    fix a a' b b'
    define A where "A = Collect (?eq a a' b b')"
    define x1 where "x1 = The (?eq a a' b b')"
    note q_gt_0[simp del]
    have "A âŠ† {x1}" by(auto simp add: A_def x1_def)
    hence "card (A âˆ© {..<q}) â‰¤ card {x1}" by(intro card_mono) auto
    also have "â€¦ = 1" by simp
    finally have "spmf (map_spmf (Î»x. x âˆˆ A) (sample_uniform q)) True â‰¤ 1 / q"
      using q_gt_0 unfolding sample_uniform_def
      by(subst map_mem_spmf_of_set)(auto simp add: field_simps)
    then show "spmf (map_spmf (?eq a a' b b') (sample_uniform q)) True â‰¤ 1 / q"
      unfolding A_def mem_Collect_eq .
  qed auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

Theory Sigma_Protocols

sectionâ€¹â€¹Î£â€º-Protocolsâ€º

textâ€¹â€¹Î£â€º-protocols were first introduced as an abstract notion by Cramer \cite{Cramerthesis}. 
We point the reader to \cite{sigma_protocols} for a good introduction to the primitive as well as informal proofs
of many of the constructions we formalise in this work. In particular the construction of commitment schemes from 
â€¹Î£â€º-protocols and the construction of compound AND and OR statements.

In this section we define â€¹Î£â€º-protocols then provide a general proof that they can be used to construct commitment schemes.
Defining security for â€¹Î£â€º-protocols uses a mixture of the game-based and simulation-based paradigms. The honest verifier 
zero knowledge property is considered using simulation-based proof, thus we follow the follow the simulation-based formalisation 
of \cite{DBLP:journals/afp/AspinallB19} and \cite{DBLP:conf/itp/Butler0G17}.â€º

subsectionâ€¹Defining â€¹Î£â€º-protocolsâ€º

theory Sigma_Protocols imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
  Commitment_Schemes
begin

type_synonym ('msg', 'challenge', 'response') conv_tuple = "('msg' Ã— 'challenge' Ã— 'response')"

type_synonym ('msg','response') sim_out = "('msg' Ã— 'response')"

type_synonym ('pub_input', 'msg', 'challenge', 'response', 'witness') prover_adversary 
                  = "'pub_input' â‡’ ('msg', 'challenge', 'response') conv_tuple 
                        â‡’ ('msg', 'challenge', 'response') conv_tuple â‡’ 'witness' spmf"

locale Î£_protocols_base =
  fixes init :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'witness â‡’ ('rand Ã— 'msg) spmf" â€• â€¹initial message in â€¹Î£â€º-protocolâ€º
    and response :: "'rand â‡’ 'witness â‡’ 'challenge  â‡’ 'response spmf" 
    and check :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'msg â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ 'response â‡’ bool"
    and Rel :: "('pub_input Ã— 'witness) set" â€• â€¹The relation the â€¹Î£â€º protocol is considered overâ€º
    and S_raw :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ ('msg, 'response) sim_out spmf" â€• â€¹Simulator for the HVZK propertyâ€º
    and ğ’œss :: "('pub_input, 'msg, 'challenge, 'response, 'witness) prover_adversary" â€• â€¹Special soundness adversaryâ€º
    and challenge_space :: "'challenge set" â€• â€¹The set of valid challengesâ€º
    and valid_pub :: "'pub_input set"

begin

lemma assumes "x âˆˆ Domain Rel" shows "âˆƒ w. (x,w) âˆˆ Rel"
  using assms by auto

textâ€¹The language defined by the relation is the set of all public inputs such that there exists a witness that satisfies the relation.â€º 

definition "L â‰¡ {x. âˆƒ w. (x, w) âˆˆ Rel}"

textâ€¹The first property of â€¹Î£â€º-protocols we consider is completeness, we define a probabilistic programme 
that runs the components of the protocol and outputs the boolean defined by the check algorithm.â€º

definition completeness_game :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'witness â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "completeness_game h w e = do {
    (r, a) â† init h w;
    z â† response r w e;
    return_spmf (check h a e z)}" 

textâ€¹We define completeness as the probability that the completeness-game returns true for all challenges assuming the relation holds on â€¹hâ€º and â€¹wâ€º.â€º

definition "completeness â‰¡ (âˆ€ h w e . (h,w) âˆˆ Rel âŸ¶ e âˆˆ challenge_space âŸ¶ spmf (completeness_game h w e) True = 1)"

textâ€¹Second we consider the honest verifier zero knowledge property (HVZK). To reason about this we construct the real view of the 
â€¹Î£â€º-protocol given a challenge â€¹eâ€º as input.â€º

definition R :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'witness â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ ('msg, 'challenge, 'response) conv_tuple spmf"
  where "R h w e = do { 
    (r,a) â† init h w;
    z â† response r w e;
    return_spmf (a,e,z)}"

definition S where "S h e = map_spmf (Î» (a, z). (a, e, z)) (S_raw h e)"

lemma lossless_S_raw_imp_lossless_S: "lossless_spmf (S_raw h e) âŸ¶ lossless_spmf (S h e)"
  by(simp add: S_def)

textâ€¹The HVZK property requires that the simulator's output distribution is equal to the real views output distribution.â€º 

definition "HVZK â‰¡ (âˆ€e âˆˆ challenge_space. 
                      (âˆ€(h, w)âˆˆRel. R h w e = S h e)
                        âˆ§ (âˆ€h âˆˆ valid_pub. âˆ€(a, z) âˆˆ set_spmf (S_raw h e). check h a e z))"

textâ€¹The final property to consider is that of special soundness. This says that given two valid transcripts such that the challenges 
are not equal there exists an adversary â€¹ğ’œssâ€º that can output the witness.â€º  

definition "special_soundness â‰¡ (âˆ€ h e e' a z z'. h âˆˆ valid_pub âŸ¶ e âˆˆ challenge_space âŸ¶ e' âˆˆ challenge_space âŸ¶  e â‰  e' 
              âŸ¶ check h a e z âŸ¶ check h a e' z' âŸ¶ (lossless_spmf (ğ’œss h (a,e,z) (a, e', z')) âˆ§ 
                  (âˆ€w'âˆˆset_spmf (ğ’œss h (a,e,z) (a,e',z')). (h,w') âˆˆ Rel)))"

lemma special_soundness_alt:
  "special_soundness âŸ·
      (âˆ€ h a e z e' z'. e âˆˆ challenge_space âŸ¶ e' âˆˆ challenge_space âŸ¶ h âˆˆ valid_pub 
          âŸ¶ e â‰  e' âŸ¶ check h a e z âˆ§ check h a e' z' 
              âŸ¶ bind_spmf (ğ’œss h (a,e,z) (a,e',z')) (Î» w'. return_spmf ((h,w') âˆˆ Rel)) = return_spmf True)"
  apply(auto simp add: special_soundness_def map_spmf_conv_bind_spmf[symmetric] map_pmf_eq_return_pmf_iff in_set_spmf lossless_iff_set_pmf_None)
  apply(metis Domain.DomainI in_set_spmf not_Some_eq)
  using Domain.intros by blast +

definition "Î£_protocol â‰¡ completeness âˆ§ special_soundness âˆ§ HVZK"

textâ€¹General lemmasâ€º

lemma lossless_complete_game: 
  assumes lossless_init: "âˆ€ h w. lossless_spmf (init h w)"
    and lossless_response: "âˆ€ r w e. lossless_spmf (response r w e)"

lemma complete_game_return_true:
  assumes "(h,w) âˆˆ Rel" 
    and "completeness"
    and lossless_init: "âˆ€ h w. lossless_spmf (init h w)"
    and lossless_response: "âˆ€ r w e. lossless_spmf (response r w e)"

qed

subsectionâ€¹Commitments from â€¹Î£â€º-protocolsâ€º

textâ€¹In this section we provide a general proof that â€¹Î£â€º-protocols can be used to construct commitment schemes. 
We follow  the construction given by Damgard in \cite{sigma_protocols}.â€º

locale Î£_protocols_to_commitments = Î£_protocols_base init response check Rel S_raw ğ’œss challenge_space valid_pub
  for init :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'witness â‡’ ('rand Ã— 'msg) spmf"
    and response :: "'rand â‡’ 'witness â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ 'response spmf"
    and check :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'msg â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ 'response â‡’ bool"
    and Rel :: "('pub_input Ã— 'witness) set"
    and S_raw :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ ('msg, 'response) sim_out spmf"
    and ğ’œss :: "('pub_input, 'msg, 'challenge, 'response, 'witness) prover_adversary"
    and challenge_space :: "'challenge set"
    and valid_pub :: "'pub_input set"
    and G :: "('pub_input Ã— 'witness) spmf" â€• â€¹generates pairs that satisfy the relationâ€º
    +
  assumes Î£_prot: "Î£_protocol" â€• â€¹assume we have a â€¹Î£â€º-protocolâ€º
    and set_spmf_G_rel [simp]: "(h,w) âˆˆ set_spmf G âŸ¹ (h,w) âˆˆ Rel" â€• â€¹the generator has the desired propertyâ€º  
    and lossless_G: "lossless_spmf G"
    and lossless_init: "lossless_spmf (init h w)"
    and lossless_response: "lossless_spmf (response r w e)"

lemma set_spmf_G_domain_rel [simp]: "(h,w) âˆˆ set_spmf G âŸ¹ h âˆˆ Domain Rel" 
  using set_spmf_G_rel by fast

lemma set_spmf_G_L [simp]: "(h,w) âˆˆ set_spmf G âŸ¹ h âˆˆ L"
  by (metis mem_Collect_eq set_spmf_G_rel L_def)

textâ€¹We define the advantage associated with the hard relation, this is used in the proof of the binding property where
we reduce the binding advantage to the relation advantage.â€º

definition rel_game :: "('pub_input â‡’ 'witness spmf) â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "rel_game ğ’œ = TRY do {
    (h,w) â† G;
    w' â† ğ’œ h;
    return_spmf ((h,w') âˆˆ Rel)} ELSE return_spmf False"

definition rel_advantage :: "('pub_input â‡’ 'witness spmf) â‡’ real"
  where "rel_advantage ğ’œ â‰¡ spmf (rel_game ğ’œ) True"

textâ€¹We now define the algorithms that define the commitment scheme constructed from a â€¹Î£â€º-protocol.â€º

definition key_gen :: "('pub_input Ã—  ('pub_input Ã— 'witness)) spmf"
  where 
   "key_gen = do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    return_spmf (x, (x,w))}"

definition commit :: "'pub_input â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ ('msg Ã—  'response) spmf"
  where
    "commit x e = do {
    (a,e,z) â† S x e;
    return_spmf (a, z)}"

definition verify :: "('pub_input Ã— 'witness) â‡’ 'challenge â‡’ 'msg â‡’  'response â‡’ bool"
  where "verify x e a z = (check (fst x) a e z)"

textâ€¹We allow the adversary to output any message, so this means the type constraint is enoughâ€º

definition "valid_msg m = (m âˆˆ challenge_space)"

textâ€¹Showing the construction of a commitment scheme from a â€¹Î£â€º-protocol is a  valid commitment scheme is trivial.â€º

sublocale abstract_com: abstract_commitment key_gen commit verify valid_msg .

paragraphâ€¹Correctnessâ€º

lemma commit_correct:
  shows "abstract_com.correct"
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
  have "âˆ€ m âˆˆ challenge_space. abstract_com.correct_game m = return_spmf True"
  proof
    fix m
    assume m: "m âˆˆ challenge_space"
    show "abstract_com.correct_game m = return_spmf True"
    proof-
    have "abstract_com.correct_game m = do {
      (ck, (vk1,vk2)) â† key_gen;
      (a,e,z) â† S ck m;
      return_spmf (check vk1 a m z)}" 
      unfolding abstract_com.correct_game_def
      by(simp add: commit_def verify_def split_def)
    also have "... = do { 
      (x,w) â† G;
      let (ck, (vk1,vk2)) = (x,(x,w));
      (a,e,z) â† S ck m;
      return_spmf (check vk1 a m z)}"
      by(simp add: key_gen_def split_def)
    also have "... = do {
      (x,w) â† G;
      (a,e,z) â† S x m;
      return_spmf (check x a m z)}"
      by(simp add: Let_def)
    also have "... = do {
      (x,w) â† G;
      (a, e,z) â† R x w m;
      return_spmf (check x a m z)}"
      using Î£_prot HVZK_unfold1 m
      by(intro bind_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)
    also have "... = do {
      (x,w) â† G;
      (r, a) â† init x w;
      z â† response r w m;
      return_spmf (check x a m z)}"
      by(simp add: R_def split_def)
    also have "... = do {
      (x,w) â† G;
      return_spmf True}"
      apply(intro bind_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)
      using complete_game_return_true lossless_init lossless_response Î£_prot Î£_protocol_def
      by(simp add: split_def completeness_game_def Î£_protocols_base.Î£_protocol_def m cong: bind_spmf_cong_simp)
    ultimately show "abstract_com.correct_game m = return_spmf True"
      by(simp add: bind_spmf_const lossless_G lossless_weight_spmfD split_def)
  qed
qed
  thus ?thesis 
    using abstract_com.correct_def abstract_com.valid_msg_set_def valid_msg_def by simp
qed

paragraphâ€¹The hiding propertyâ€º

textâ€¹We first show we have perfect hiding with respect to the hiding game that allows the adversary to choose
the messages that are committed to, this is akin to the ind-cpa game for encryption schemes.â€º

lemma perfect_hiding:
  shows "abstract_com.perfect_hiding_ind_cpa ğ’œ"
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
  obtain ğ’œ1 ğ’œ2 where [simp]: "ğ’œ = (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2)" by(cases ğ’œ)
  have "abstract_com.hiding_game_ind_cpa (ğ’œ1, ğ’œ2) = TRY do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x,w);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    b â† coin_spmf; 
    (a,e,z) â† S x (if b then m0 else m1);
    b' â† ğ’œ2 a Ïƒ;
    return_spmf (b' = b)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    by(simp add: abstract_com.hiding_game_ind_cpa_def commit_def; simp add: key_gen_def split_def)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x,w);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    b :: bool â† coin_spmf; 
    (a,e,z) â† R x w (if b then m0 else m1);
    b' :: bool â† ğ’œ2 a Ïƒ;
    return_spmf (b' = b)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    apply(intro try_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)+
    by(simp add: Î£_prot  HVZK_unfold1 valid_msg_def)
  also have "... = TRY do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x,w);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    b â† coin_spmf; 
    (r,a) â† init x w;
    z :: 'response â† response r w (if b then m0 else m1);
    guess :: bool â† ğ’œ2 a Ïƒ;
    return_spmf(guess = b)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    using Î£_protocols_base.R_def 
    by(simp add: bind_map_spmf o_def R_def split_def)
  also have  "... = TRY do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x,w);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    b â† coin_spmf; 
    (r,a) â† init x w;
    guess :: bool â† ğ’œ2 a Ïƒ;
    return_spmf(guess = b)} ELSE coin_spmf"
    by(simp add: bind_spmf_const lossless_response lossless_weight_spmfD)
  also have  "... = TRY do {
    (x,w) â† G;
    ((m0, m1), Ïƒ) â† ğ’œ1 (x,w);
    _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (valid_msg m0 âˆ§ valid_msg m1);
    (r,a) â† init x w;
    guess :: bool â† ğ’œ2 a Ïƒ;
    map_spmf( (=) guess) coin_spmf} ELSE coin_spmf"
    apply(simp add: map_spmf_conv_bind_spmf)
    by(simp add: split_def)
  also have "... = coin_spmf" 
    by(auto simp add: map_eq_const_coin_spmf try_bind_spmf_lossless2' Let_def split_def bind_spmf_const scale_bind_spmf weight_spmf_le_1 scale_scale_spmf)
  ultimately have "spmf (abstract_com.hiding_game_ind_cpa ğ’œ) True = 1/2"
    by(simp add: spmf_of_set)
  thus ?thesis
    by (simp add: abstract_com.perfect_hiding_ind_cpa_def abstract_com.hiding_advantage_ind_cpa_def)
qed

textâ€¹We reduce the security of the binding property to the relation advantage. To do this we first construct 
an adversary that interacts with the relation game. This adversary succeeds if the binding adversary succeeds.â€º

definition adversary :: "('pub_input â‡’ ('msg Ã— 'challenge Ã— 'response Ã— 'challenge Ã— 'response) spmf) â‡’ 'pub_input â‡’ 'witness spmf"
  where "adversary ğ’œ x = do {
    (c, e, ez, e', ez') â† ğ’œ x;
    ğ’œss x (c,e,ez) (c,e',ez')}"

lemma bind_advantage:
  shows "abstract_com.bind_advantage ğ’œ â‰¤ rel_advantage (adversary ğ’œ)"
proof-
  have "abstract_com.bind_game ğ’œ = TRY do {
  (x,w) â† G;
  (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ x;
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (m â‰  m' âˆ§ m âˆˆ challenge_space âˆ§ m' âˆˆ challenge_space);
  let b = check x c m d;
  let b' = check x c m' d';
  _ :: unit â† assert_spmf (b âˆ§ b'); 
  w' â† ğ’œss x (c,m, d) (c,m', d');
  return_spmf ((x,w') âˆˆ Rel)} ELSE return_spmf False"
    unfolding abstract_com.bind_game_alt_def 
    apply(simp add:  key_gen_def verify_def Let_def split_def valid_msg_def)
    apply(intro try_spmf_cong bind_spmf_cong[OF refl]; clarsimp?)+
    using special_soundness_def Î£_prot Î£_protocol_def special_soundness_alt special_soundness_def set_spmf_G_rel set_spmf_G_domain_rel 
    by (smt basic_trans_rules(31) bind_spmf_cong domain_subset_valid_pub)
  hence "abstract_com.bind_advantage ğ’œ â‰¤ spmf (TRY do {
  (x,w) â† G;
  (c, m, d, m', d') â† ğ’œ x;
  w' â† ğ’œss x (c,m, d) (c,m', d');
  return_spmf ((x,w') âˆˆ Rel)} ELSE return_spmf False) True"
    unfolding abstract_com.bind_advantage_def
    apply(simp add: spmf_try_spmf)
    apply(rule ord_spmf_eq_leD)
    apply(rule ord_spmf_bind_reflI;clarsimp)+
    by(simp add: assert_spmf_def)
  thus ?thesis
    by(simp add: rel_game_def adversary_def split_def rel_advantage_def)
qed

end

end

Theory Schnorr_Sigma_Commit

subsectionâ€¹Schnorr â€¹Î£â€º-protocolâ€º

textâ€¹In this section we show the Schnoor protocol \cite{DBLP:journals/joc/Schnorr91} is a â€¹Î£â€º-protocol and then use it to construct a commitment scheme.

lemma completeness: "Schnorr_Î£.completeness"
proof-
